heading: Grenade Rogue Endgame Build Guide
content: Welcome to the Grenade Rogue Endgame Guide! This specialized build features a unique playstyle focused on maximizing your damage with and the other 3 Stun Grenade aspects: . You focus on hunting Elites, grouping enemies near them, and blowing them to bits with an endless salvo of explosives. Each time you enter and exit , you drop a set of 4 Stun Grenades, dealing damage and Stunning all enemies hit. The new lets you do this easily by creating a smoke cloud that grants you every second while you remain inside. This means you can still perform other actions while periodically entering By reducing the cooldown of to 5 seconds or less, each time you hit an Elite with you immediately reset its cooldown and can throw another thanks to . This creates overlapping smoke clouds with individual timers from , significantly increasing the rate at which you enter and exit . Additionally, activates each time you throw , dealing some more consistent damage. The Grenade Rogue taps into the saboteur side of the Rogue, grouping your enemies together and blowing them up when the time is right. Continue reading to learn all there is to know about the Grenade Rogue. Season 6 is the . It features the faction which hunts Realmwalkers, massive behemoths that roam outdoor zones and beckon Mephisto's hellspawn. Participate in these zone events and take down the Realmwalkers to spawn a portal to a Seething Realm. There you can acquire Seething Opals, new consumables that stack with Elixirs for an XP buff and the chance to gather extra rewards when defeating enemies. The types of Opals are: Use these Opals at all times to earn reputation with the faction and unlock further rewards. to reset your Ultimate Skill, which in turn resets all your other skills. This allows you to reset your cooldowns when you cast while giving you some extra Damage Reduction. The Grenade Rogue does not spend but you reduce the cooldown of by other means. Use the slider to see the progression steps. At around Paragon 200, leveling slows down significantly and all important nodes and Glyph sockets should be unlocked. Afterwards, you can min/max your build with minor tweaks and by picking up additional smaller nodes. Some Glyph position swaps, board changes and other pathing adjustments may occur as you unlock your full potential. The setup displayed by default is the final version of the build before spending additional points that do not significantly impact your character's power. You can have up to two Runewords in your setup, each consisting of one Rune. Socket them into your Armor pieces to replace normal gems. The Grenade Rogue focuses on the following combos: If you haven't unlocked the final setup or found the top runes, you can also benefit from these options: are unlocked during the Vessel of Hatred campaign and assist you in battle. There are 4 separate Mercenaries to choose from, each with their own skill trees and abilities. You can have one (permanent) mercenary during solo play and a who assists you from time to time in certain situations. He offers you unparalleled defense that in turn buffs your offense. reduce the damage you take and save you in dire situations. gives you two great damage boosts as Raheir uses his skills either to save you or to attack enemies. Call Varyana, the Berserker Crone as your Mercenary when you cast to attack with , amplifying your damage through the Knock Down bonus and applying additional Stagger to bosses. To enable the Grenade Rogue to perform optimally, hunt for these stats on your gear with good rolls and aim to them accordingly. Keep in mind that certain stats, such as Armor, Resistances, Extra Size Tempers, Attack Speed and more, have caps that may affect your priorities according to the items and Paragon points available at that moment. Before you dive into the Endgame with the Grenade Rogue, take a look at this overview of the items used in the build. See below for further details about the different progression steps and variants. Some of your Skill Tree choices depend on what items are available to you. Keep in mind that while we can guarantee that everyone has access to the same Aspects, the exact progression is different for everyone. This section is designed to guide your Grenade Rogue from a fresh level 60 into the very late endgame using the three variants . At the final step, you should be fully decked out with a great all-rounder build. If you are fresh in Torment 1 coming from a leveling guide, this is where you begin. Since only some Aspects can be guaranteed from Dungeon unlocks for the , focus on acquiring the additional aspects via gambling with The goal here is to progress through the Torment difficulties as you unlock Ancestrals, Paragon points, all and the most important to pilot this build. Some are used temporarily to fill slots that may be replaced with more items later on. This is the final version of the build's progression, including all regular , leaving you with a great all-rounder build for all content in the game. Additional variants use this as a baseline to optimize around certain activities. This setup optimizes the build to push the highest possible Tiers in after you have finished the variant and reached a plateau in your progression. There are no changes from the setup for Pit Pushing. This Speedfarming variant optimizes the build for easy activities like Tiers after you have finished the variant and reached a plateau in your progression. There are no changes from the setup for Speedfarming. Find answers to commonly asked questions and dive deeper into the Grenade Rogue Build's mechanics. The build works really well when you decimate everything in seconds, but may get overwhelmed if fights are long against high level monsters. There are several adjustments you can make when you have trouble with more difficult content: Generally Hardcore and Softcore share the same builds. Outside of being more prudent in your gameplay, you can also tweak the setup slightly to raise your survivability: While Stun Grenades from are buffed by the 4 Grenade Aspects, the starting point for scaling is significantly lower than . By dividing the damage of your Aspect by your Max Weapon Damage, you can calculate the % Weapon Damage Scaling of all Aspects. Below is the calculation when Dual-Wielding Swords: The base damage of Stun Grenades is 40% of your Weapon Damage, which is 9 times lower than Written damage values on all Aspects are based on your Weapon Damage. As this changes, the tooltips dynamically update to the new value. Here are the values for the 4 Weapons available to Rogue assuming 800 Item Power: always uses your last used Weapon so to maximize the raw damage of your Stun Grenades, cast prior to continuously casting as they both use your Ranged Weapon. Learn about the mechanical details that make the build tick. Read up more on Attack Speed in our Bosses are immune to Crowd Control (CC) and instead take Stagger Damage when hit by one. The amount of stagger damage dealt depends on the type of CC and is proportional to its duration. After being hit by a CC effect, the Boss temporarily takes less Stagger Damage from CC of the same type. Effectively, this means that when you're just spamming one type of CC you don't need to spam any more of it than what you need to keep a normal enemy permanently CC-d. To stagger the Boss quickly you need to use as many different types of CC as possible. After the Boss is staggered it gains a certain amount of stacking Stagger Damage Reduction for the rest of the fight: Bosses naturally regain 1% of their Stagger HP every second and when that regeneration is combined with 90% Stagger Damage Reduction it becomes borderline impossible to Stagger the Boss again without significant investment in Crowd Control. Coming soon. The Grenade Rogue lets you relentlessly bombard your enemies with to constantly enter and exit while dropping Stun Grenades from the shadows to blow up all enemies. This is an extremely satisfying and unique Rogue build for those who enjoy the saboteur aspect of the class. Reviewed by

Outside of being more prudent in your gameplay, you can also tweak the setup slightly to raise your survivability: While Stun Grenades from are buffed by the 4 Grenade Aspects, the starting point for scaling is significantly lower than . By dividing the damage of your Aspect by your Max Weapon Damage, you can calculate the % Weapon Damage Scaling of all Aspects. Below is the calculation when Dual-Wielding Swords: The base damage of Stun Grenades is 40% of your Weapon Damage, which is 9 times lower than Written damage values on all Aspects are based on your Weapon Damage. As this changes, the tooltips dynamically update to the new value. Here are the values for the 4 Weapons available to Rogue assuming 800 Item Power: always uses your last used Weapon so to maximize the raw damage of your Stun Grenades, cast prior to continuously casting as they both use your Ranged Weapon. Learn about the mechanical details that make the build tick. Read up more on Attack Speed in our Bosses are immune to Crowd Control (CC) and instead take Stagger Damage when hit by one. The amount of stagger damage dealt depends on the type of CC and is proportional to its duration. After being hit by a CC effect, the Boss temporarily takes less Stagger Damage from CC of the same type. Effectively, this means that when you're just spamming one type of CC you don't need to spam any more of it than what you need to keep a normal enemy permanently CC-d. To stagger the Boss quickly you need to use as many different types of CC as possible. After the Boss is staggered it gains a certain amount of stacking Stagger Damage Reduction for the rest of the fight: Bosses naturally regain 1% of their Stagger HP every second and when that regeneration is combined with 90% Stagger Damage Reduction it becomes borderline impossible to Stagger the Boss again without significant investment in Crowd Control. Coming soon. The Grenade Rogue lets you relentlessly bombard your enemies with to constantly enter and exit while dropping Stun Grenades from the shadows to blow up all enemies. This is an extremely satisfying and unique Rogue build for those who enjoy the saboteur aspect of the class. Reviewed by

This is an extremely satisfying and unique Rogue build for those who enjoy the saboteur aspect of the class. Reviewed by

The Grenade Rogue taps into the saboteur side of the Rogue, grouping your enemies together and blowing them up when the time is right. Continue reading to learn all there is to know about the Grenade Rogue. Season 6 is the . It features the faction which hunts Realmwalkers, massive behemoths that roam outdoor zones and beckon Mephisto's hellspawn. Participate in these zone events and take down the Realmwalkers to spawn a portal to a Seething Realm. There you can acquire Seething Opals, new consumables that stack with Elixirs for an XP buff and the chance to gather extra rewards when defeating enemies. The types of Opals are: Use these Opals at all times to earn reputation with the faction and unlock further rewards. to reset your Ultimate Skill, which in turn resets all your other skills. This allows you to reset your cooldowns when you cast while giving you some extra Damage Reduction. The Grenade Rogue does not spend but you reduce the cooldown of by other means. Use the slider to see the progression steps. At around Paragon 200, leveling slows down significantly and all important nodes and Glyph sockets should be unlocked. Afterwards, you can min/max your build with minor tweaks and by picking up additional smaller nodes. Some Glyph position swaps, board changes and other pathing adjustments may occur as you unlock your full potential. The setup displayed by default is the final version of the build before spending additional points that do not significantly impact your character's power. You can have up to two Runewords in your setup, each consisting of one Rune. Socket them into your Armor pieces to replace normal gems. The Grenade Rogue focuses on the following combos: If you haven't unlocked the final setup or found the top runes, you can also benefit from these options: are unlocked during the Vessel of Hatred campaign and assist you in battle. There are 4 separate Mercenaries to choose from, each with their own skill trees and abilities. You can have one (permanent) mercenary during solo play and a who assists you from time to time in certain situations. He offers you unparalleled defense that in turn buffs your offense. reduce the damage you take and save you in dire situations. gives you two great damage boosts as Raheir uses his skills either to save you or to attack enemies. Call Varyana, the Berserker Crone as your Mercenary when you cast to attack with , amplifying your damage through the Knock Down bonus and applying additional Stagger to bosses. To enable the Grenade Rogue to perform optimally, hunt for these stats on your gear with good rolls and aim to them accordingly. Keep in mind that certain stats, such as Armor, Resistances, Extra Size Tempers, Attack Speed and more, have caps that may affect your priorities according to the items and Paragon points available at that moment. Before you dive into the Endgame with the Grenade Rogue, take a look at this overview of the items used in the build. See below for further details about the different progression steps and variants. This section is designed to guide your Grenade Rogue from a fresh level 60 into the very late endgame using the three variants . At the final step, you should be fully decked out with a great all-rounder build. If you are fresh in Torment 1 coming from a leveling guide, this is where you begin. Since only some Aspects can be guaranteed from Dungeon unlocks for the , focus on acquiring the additional aspects via gambling with The goal here is to progress through the Torment difficulties as you unlock Ancestrals, Paragon points, all and the most important to pilot this build. Some are used temporarily to fill slots that may be replaced with more items later on. Below is the calculation when Dual-Wielding Swords: The base damage of Stun Grenades is 40% of your Weapon Damage, which is 9 times lower than Written damage values on all Aspects are based on your Weapon Damage. Learn about the mechanical details that make the build tick. Read up more on Attack Speed in our Bosses are immune to Crowd Control (CC) and instead take Stagger Damage when hit by one. The amount of stagger damage dealt depends on the type of CC and is proportional to its duration. After being hit by a CC effect, the Boss temporarily takes less Stagger Damage from CC of the same type. Effectively, this means that when you're just spamming one type of CC you don't need to spam any more of it than what you need to keep a normal enemy permanently CC-d. To stagger the Boss quickly you need to use as many different types of CC as possible. After the Boss is staggered it gains a certain amount of stacking Stagger Damage Reduction for the rest of the fight: Bosses naturally regain 1% of their Stagger HP every second and when that regeneration is combined with 90% Stagger Damage Reduction it becomes borderline impossible to Stagger the Boss again without significant investment in Crowd Control. After being hit by a CC effect, the Boss temporarily takes less Stagger Damage from CC of the same type. Effectively, this means that when you're just spamming one type of CC you don't need to spam any more of it than what you need to keep a normal enemy permanently CC-d. To stagger the Boss quickly you need to use as many different types of CC as possible. After the Boss is staggered it gains a certain amount of stacking Stagger Damage Reduction for the rest of the fight: Bosses naturally regain 1% of their Stagger HP every second and when that regeneration is combined with 90% Stagger Damage Reduction it becomes borderline impossible to Stagger the Boss again without significant investment in Crowd Control. Coming soon. The Grenade Rogue lets you relentlessly bombard your enemies with to constantly enter and exit while dropping Stun Grenades from the shadows to blow up all enemies. This is an extremely satisfying and unique Rogue build for those who enjoy the saboteur aspect of the class. Reviewed by

After the Boss is staggered it gains a certain amount of stacking Stagger Damage Reduction for the rest of the fight: Bosses naturally regain 1% of their Stagger HP every second and when that regeneration is combined with 90% Stagger Damage Reduction it becomes borderline impossible to Stagger the Boss again without significant investment in Crowd Control. Coming soon. The Grenade Rogue lets you relentlessly bombard your enemies with to constantly enter and exit while dropping Stun Grenades from the shadows to blow up all enemies. This is an extremely satisfying and unique Rogue build for those who enjoy the saboteur aspect of the class. Reviewed by

Use the slider to see the progression steps. At around Paragon 200, leveling slows down significantly and all important nodes and Glyph sockets should be unlocked. Some Glyph position swaps, board changes and other pathing adjustments may occur as you unlock your full potential. The setup displayed by default is the final version of the build before spending additional points that do not significantly impact your character's power. You can have up to two Runewords in your setup, each consisting of one Rune. Socket them into your Armor pieces to replace normal gems. The Grenade Rogue focuses on the following combos: If you haven't unlocked the final setup or found the top runes, you can also benefit from these options: are unlocked during the Vessel of Hatred campaign and assist you in battle. There are 4 separate Mercenaries to choose from, each with their own skill trees and abilities. You can have one (permanent) mercenary during solo play and a who assists you from time to time in certain situations. He offers you unparalleled defense that in turn buffs your offense. reduce the damage you take and save you in dire situations. gives you two great damage boosts as Raheir uses his skills either to save you or to attack enemies. Call Varyana, the Berserker Crone as your Mercenary when you cast to attack with , amplifying your damage through the Knock Down bonus and applying additional Stagger to bosses. The build works really well when you decimate everything in seconds, but may get overwhelmed if fights are long against high level monsters. There are several adjustments you can make when you have trouble with more difficult content: Generally Hardcore and Softcore share the same builds. Outside of being more prudent in your gameplay, you can also tweak the setup slightly to raise your survivability: While Stun Grenades from are buffed by the 4 Grenade Aspects, the starting point for scaling is significantly lower than . By dividing the damage of your Aspect by your Max Weapon Damage, you can calculate the % Weapon Damage Scaling of all Aspects. Below is the calculation when Dual-Wielding Swords: The base damage of Stun Grenades is 40% of your Weapon Damage, which is 9 times lower than Written damage values on all Aspects are based on your Weapon Damage. As this changes, the tooltips dynamically update to the new value. Here are the values for the 4 Weapons available to Rogue assuming 800 Item Power: always uses your last used Weapon so to maximize the raw damage of your Stun Grenades, cast prior to continuously casting as they both use your Ranged Weapon. Learn about the mechanical details that make the build tick. Read up more on Attack Speed in our Bosses are immune to Crowd Control (CC) and instead take Stagger Damage when hit by one. The amount of stagger damage dealt depends on the type of CC and is proportional to its duration. After being hit by a CC effect, the Boss temporarily takes less Stagger Damage from CC of the same type. Effectively, this means that when you're just spamming one type of CC you don't need to spam any more of it than what you need to keep a normal enemy permanently CC-d. To stagger the Boss quickly you need to use as many different types of CC as possible. After the Boss is staggered it gains a certain amount of stacking Stagger Damage Reduction for the rest of the fight: Bosses naturally regain 1% of their Stagger HP every second and when that regeneration is combined with 90% Stagger Damage Reduction it becomes borderline impossible to Stagger the Boss again without significant investment in Crowd Control. Coming soon. The Grenade Rogue lets you relentlessly bombard your enemies with to constantly enter and exit while dropping Stun Grenades from the shadows to blow up all enemies. This is an extremely satisfying and unique Rogue build for those who enjoy the saboteur aspect of the class. Reviewed by

content: Use the slider to see the progression steps. At around Paragon 200, leveling slows down significantly and all important nodes and Glyph sockets should be unlocked. The amount of stagger damage dealt depends on the type of CC and is proportional to its duration. After being hit by a CC effect, the Boss temporarily takes less Stagger Damage from CC of the same type. Effectively, this means that when you're just spamming one type of CC you don't need to spam any more of it than what you need to keep a normal enemy permanently CC-d. To stagger the Boss quickly you need to use as many different types of CC as possible. After the Boss is staggered it gains a certain amount of stacking Stagger Damage Reduction for the rest of the fight: Bosses naturally regain 1% of their Stagger HP every second and when that regeneration is combined with 90% Stagger Damage Reduction it becomes borderline impossible to Stagger the Boss again without significant investment in Crowd Control.
